revised_title: Comparative Analysis of Phoenician and Samaritan Alphabets
tldr: The author examines the similarities and differences between the Phoenician and Samaritan alphabets, focusing on the Maltese Phoenician Inscription and its relation to the Samaritan alphabet. They argue that the later an inscription is, the more its letters will differ from the Samaritan alphabet. The author also discusses the forms of specific letters, such as Thau and Aleph, and their variations in different inscriptions.
